keyPolicies.policyDescription: Grant is clear that the UK should ensure a Brexit outcome that benefits all, saying 'Brexit should enhance our status as a European partner willing to trade with old friends like the USA but in the end the fact that everything has to be agreed by 27 other EU countries meant we couldn’t make progress'. He expresses his intent to represent both those who backed leave and remain.

Grant is looking to the future and how the borough of Welwyn Hatfield can continue to work to overcome the issues of the next missions. Grant will focus on the key issues - health, transport, and local development.
Grant is passionate about local community projects and stands as a supporter and participant in several charity events to help strengthen local community ties.

issues.brexitEurope: Grant is clear that he personally would have remained - indicating a choice to ensure that our Brexit outcome benefits all.
issues.education: Grant values local schools stating 'we deliver the best schools that deliver for all children in Welwyn Hatfield by fighting for funding.'
issues.health: Grant mentions healthcare several times, indicating he will focus on health issues.

leaflet.personalStatement: "It doesn’t matter if you voted for me or not, I’m here to make sure that everyone in Welwyn Hatfield is represented both locally and nationally."

contactInformation.address: Mylady House, The Common, Hatfield, AL10 0BR

images.caption: Grant Shapps with supporters and local residents
